item.title: Comment on Data are shadows of stories by Lorena Macnaugtan
item.dc:creator: Lorena Macnaugtan
item.description: I love the way you made the two points: data (source of objectivity) is important, but stories (source for context and variation) are too. Excellent drawing!
item.content:encoded: I love the way you made the two points: data (source of objectivity) is important, but stories (source for context and variation) are too. Excellent drawing!

item.title: Comment on Online communities for sarcoma by Marina Symcox
item.dc:creator: Marina Symcox
item.description: The Leiomyosarcoma group at ACOR played a front an center role of the early days of Gleevec for GIST. The LMS group at ACOR was where a number of desperately ill GIST patients heard first word about the small breakthrough trial of STI-571 for GIST (which had until that trial been commonly referred to as GI LMS). These GIST patients on ACOR's LMS group became many of the first GIST pts in the world to take STI-571 in what was called the B-2222 trial. Without any doubt, ACOR's LMS group saved me from death. GIST Support International today exists in the open model of ACOR of the late 1990's. Our hat's are off to Gilles and ACOR. You saved our lives!
item.content:encoded: The Leiomyosarcoma group at ACOR played a front an center role of the early days of Gleevec for GIST. The LMS group at ACOR was where a number of desperately ill GIST patients heard first word about the small breakthrough trial of STI-571 for GIST (which had until that trial been commonly referred to as GI LMS). These GIST patients on ACOR’s LMS group became many of the first GIST pts in the world to take STI-571 in what was called the B-2222 trial. Without any doubt, ACOR’s LMS group saved me from death. GIST Support International today exists in the open model of ACOR of the late 1990’s. Our hat’s are off to Gilles and ACOR. You saved our lives!

item.title: Comment on Medical professionals can now “Learn from Smart Patients” by AfternoonNapper
item.dc:creator: AfternoonNapper
item.description: This is fabulous, a testament to the value that patient narratives provide, and to providers' increasing willingness to learn more about contextual evidence and whole patients rather than simply empirical data. Thank you.
item.content:encoded: This is fabulous, a testament to the value that patient narratives provide, and to providers’ increasing willingness to learn more about contextual evidence and whole patients rather than simply empirical data. Thank you.

item.title: Comment on I am the patient and I need to be heard by MJ
item.dc:creator: MJ
item.description: Amen! I am 61 yrs old and I often feel like the doctors ignore me and don't tell me everything as if it wouldn't make a difference. But it does make a difference to the patient. Many of us have a much more difficult time not knowing than if they would tell us what they are thinking.
item.content:encoded: Amen! I am 61 yrs old and I often feel like the doctors ignore me and don’t tell me everything as if it wouldn’t make a difference. But it does make a difference to the patient. Many of us have a much more difficult time not knowing than if they would tell us what they are thinking.

item.title: Comment on Stories and science by Roni Zeiger MD :: When you get to a fork in the road, stay there
item.dc:creator: Roni Zeiger MD :: When you get to a fork in the road, stay there
item.description: […] I worked at Google until I started seeing that so many of the complex questions people have about their health aren’t well answered in a document yet — but those same questions are often discussed in online communities, where a network of microexperts often provides useful feedback. So now, building Smart Patients, I sit at the intersection of stories and science. […]
item.content:encoded: […] I worked at Google until I started seeing that so many of the complex questions people have about their health aren’t well answered in a document yet — but those same questions are often discussed in online communities, where a network of microexperts often provides useful feedback. So now, building Smart Patients, I sit at the intersection of stories and science. […]

item.title: Comment on Our first year together by Ramin
item.dc:creator: Ramin
item.description: A belated congratulations on your 1 year anniversary!
item.content:encoded: A belated congratulations on your 1 year anniversary!

item.title: Comment on Real cancer stories by Roni Zeiger
item.dc:creator: Roni Zeiger
item.description: Franny, thank you for sharing a bit about your story. We will include Bonnie's comments about hospice care and preparing to die in the final video of her. The clip about tango is a preview of what this special one has shared.
item.content:encoded: Franny, thank you for sharing a bit about your story. We will include Bonnie’s comments about hospice care and preparing to die in the final video of her. The clip about tango is a preview of what this special one has shared.

item.title: Comment on Real cancer stories by Franny
item.dc:creator: Franny
item.description: Ovarian cancer remains SO difficult to diagnosis . As a ten year survivor I still have nightmares about my hospital stories associated with diagnosis. But all stories are different . Now a five year breast cancer survivor as well- yes facing the second diagnosis was another story. I love the tango story but was sad she didn't "talk" about her experience of hospice care & preparing to die.
item.content:encoded: Ovarian cancer remains SO difficult to diagnosis . As a ten year survivor I still have nightmares about my hospital stories associated with diagnosis. But all stories are different . Now a five year breast cancer survivor as well- yes facing the second diagnosis was another story. I love the tango story but was sad she didn’t “talk” about her experience of hospice care & preparing to die.

item.title: Comment on Real cancer stories by Roni Zeiger
item.dc:creator: Roni Zeiger
item.description: hi Mike, I'm so sorry for your loss. We certainly didn't mean to suggest that everyone has the same story. Just the opposite: each story is unique and important and can teach us a huge amount. Our hope is to help people who want to share their stories to do so, so that more of us can learn from them.
item.content:encoded: hi Mike, I’m so sorry for your loss. We certainly didn’t mean to suggest that everyone has the same story. Just the opposite: each story is unique and important and can teach us a huge amount. Our hope is to help people who want to share their stories to do so, so that more of us can learn from them.

item.title: Comment on Real cancer stories by Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Lucie, all of us are different. None of us are perfect. Not all cancer patients have to endure radiation or chemo, but that does not make their stories any less relevant.
item.content:encoded: Lucie, all of us are different. None of us are perfect. Not all cancer patients have to endure radiation or chemo, but that does not make their stories any less relevant.
